arts.ttl: Verdict: Burnley's clean sheet record dominates the headlines, but that ignores the real story
arts.sum: The headlines will be dominated by talk of Burnley’s record-breaking defence, and understandably so, but that wasn’t the main takeaway from this latest victory. That came at the other end.

arts.ttl: EFL confirm Hull City's squad list for relegation fight after another busy transfer window
arts.sum: There are also a host of youngsters named in the 31-man Under-21 squad for the first time, while the likes of Owen Foster, Paul Iggledun and Xavier Simons are all included despite being out on loan. Hull City's squad list for the remaining weeks of the Championship season has been published by the EFL, following a January transfer window which saw the Tigers sign eight players, and allow a host more to depart.

arts.ttl: Ruben Selles accepts blame for Hull City's defeat at Burnley after admitting what he got wrong
arts.sum: Selles felt that changing early in the second half could prompt a recovery from his side while trying to contain Burnley at the other end, but that goal failed to come and Scott Parker's side were able to see the game in relative comfort. At that point, it looked like City could be on the wrong end of a damaging result against the in-form Clarets, but a second-half recovery, coupled with Scott Parker's side taking their foot off the gas, ensured there was no greater damage to their goal difference.

arts.ttl: 'Every bit': Scott Parker makes Burnley claim following convincing victory against Hull City
arts.sum: Scott Parker felt his Burnley side looked “every bit” a top Championship side during their convincing victory against Hull City.

arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Hull City as one 9/10 handed out amid glut of 8/10s - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley broke yet another record as they became the first Championship side to keep 10 straight clean sheets following their convincing win against Hull City.

arts.ttl: Burnley keep clean sheet run going as they breeze past Hull
arts.sum: Clarets goalkeeper James Trafford last conceded a goal in December.

arts.ttl: Relegation worries grow as Hull City well beaten by in-form Burnley
arts.sum: It was a disastrous start for City against a side who hadn't conceded in nine league games, and though the hosts threatened twice more, Selles' men recovered and came close when Egan's ball was flicked on by Joseph into the path of Joe Gelhardt to fire a dipping volley just over Trafford's bar. Bashir Humphreys fizzed in a fine strike from the left side of the box into the far corner, and it didn't get much better for sorry City, who conceded again 21 minutes in when Jaidon Anthony's cross was powered home by Zian Flemming after some more questionable defending.

arts.ttl: Burnley 2-0 Hull City: Clarets turn on the style as unbeaten run extends to 21 games
arts.sum: Burnley delivered one of their most complete 45-minute displays of the season to put Hull City to the sword.

arts.ttl: Burnley team news vs Hull City as Scott Parker reverts back to Oxford United starting XI
arts.sum: Burnley have reverted back to the same side that beat Oxford United in their last league outing for tonight’s clash against Hull City.

arts.ttl: Hull City notebook as the Tigers 'plot' summer transfer raid for Joseph Olowu
arts.sum: Buoyed after dumping Premier League Southampton out of the FA Cup, Burnley will be looking to extend their impressive unbeaten run to 21 matches when they welcome the Tigers to Turf Moor tonight, kick-off 7:45pm. The Tigers have a wretched recent record at Turf Moor, losing 10 of their last 14 away league matches against Burnley (W2 D2).
